newsitem.title: USA: Chinese chemical ADRs up on funding rumors.
newsitem.headline: Chinese chemical ADRs up on funding rumors.

text.p: Chinese petrochemical ADRs stood out on the New York Stock Exchange Wednesday, bolstered by rumors the companies could have better access to funding, traders said.

ADRs -- American Depositary Receipts -- in Jilin Chemical Industrial Co rose 3-7/16 to 21-1/8, a 12-month high. Volume at midday was almost 20 times normal daily levels, and Jilin was the percentage-gain leader on the exchange.

Beijing Yanhua Petrochemical Co Ltd was in the No 2 spot, rising 1-1/4 to 10-5/8 in normal volume. Shanghai Petrochemical Co Ltd was up 1-7/8 to 26-1/8 and also was among the most active issues on the New York Stock Exchange.

Traders said the ADRs were up after rumors in Hong Kong that Chinese state agencies controlling the companies and others would be restructured. The shakeup would give the companies more access to agency assets.
"Everything was denied, but the speculation is that the companies will suddenly have more access to capital," a trader said.
"We haven't had anything confirmed yet. We're still trying to sort things out."
ADRs allow U.S. trade of foreign shares.
